svcsubsecinfo.para: Getting a good cab door to door opening fit requires a knowledge of where the various adjustments are located and what effect each adjustment has on door fit. These adjustments apply whether door has been removed or door adjustment is simply being changed or improved.

When the door is properly adjusted, it should fit the opening with 1/4 to 5/16 inch (6 to 8 mm) space all around the door frame. A newspaper sheet should not be able to pass between the weather seal and door frame (paper should tear).

item.para: Door weather seal should contact the door frame with slight pressure but without damage to the seal.
Door should latch, lock and release without undue effort.
Door should not rattle when vehicle is moving.

svcproc.title: HINGE AT CAB HINGE PILLAR (BEFORE AND AFTER DECEMBER 5, 1994)
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 51for Items in parentheses.

figure.caption: Figure 51. Hinge at Cab Hinge Pillar

svcproc.para: Adjust door up and down or in and out at enlarged holes in hinge (Item 2) at cab hinge pillar location (Item 3).

step1.para: Slightly loosen three flanged head mounting bolts (Item 1), one hinge at a time. Use a universal (flex) socket to loosen the flanged head bolt recessed behind hinge inside pillar.
Move door up, down, in or out as required to obtain proper door position.
Once door adjustment is made, hold door in place and tighten mounting bolts (Item 1). Tighten to 13 to 15 ft-lbs. (17.6 to 20 Nm).
Once the first hinge is adjusted, repeat this procedure to adjust the other hinge.
After both hinges have been adjusted, close door and check for proper fit. If further adjustment is required, repeat this procedure.
